div.style: display: inline-block; background-color: #d9e0e7; padding: 6px; margin: 4px; border: 1px solid #8da1b4; border-radius: 5px; line-height: 60%

div.p: The official URL for this implementation guide is:
FHIR IG for road safety and health information in the Philippines

title.value: DRAFT PH Road Safety Implementation Guide

publisher.value: UP Manila - National Institutes of Health - National Telehealth Center

name.value: UP Manila - National Institutes of Health - National Telehealth Center

description.value: FHIR IG for road safety and health information in the Philippines

valueMarkdown.value: Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on HL7 Terminology
Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on the HL7 Extension Pack

name.value: MDSRoadSafety Logical Model to FHIR Mapping

description.value: Maps elements from the logical model to FHIR R4 resources. Generated by scripts/generate-conceptmap.js
Known allergies, substances and reactions.

Document Bundle for EMS Run Report submission. The first entry MUST be a Composition that organizes and references the other resources in the bundle (Patient, Encounter, Location, Observations, DocumentReference, Procedure, ServiceRequest, Task, Claim).

Document Bundle for Facility ONEISS submission. The first entry MUST be a Composition that organizes and references the other resources in the bundle (Patient, Encounter, Condition, Observations, DocumentReference, Procedure, ServiceRequest).
Document Bundle for Post‑Crash investigation submission. The first entry MUST be a Composition that organizes and references post‑crash Observations and supporting DocumentReferences.
Claim information related to cost of care.

Composition that organises an EMS run report. Sections MUST reference the other resources present in the corresponding document Bundle (Patient, Encounter, Location, Observations, DocumentReference, Procedure, ServiceRequest, Task, Claim).

Composition that organises a facility (ONEISS) submission. Sections MUST reference the other resources present in the corresponding document Bundle (Patient, Encounter, Condition, Observations, DocumentReference, Procedure, ServiceRequest).

Composition that organises a Post‑Crash submission. Sections reference Observations and Documents related to post‑crash investigation (collision type, investigator presence, other risk factors, safety accessories, vehicle condition, CCTV, evidence documents).

Condition resource for Road Safety IG that supports multiple coding systems, textual entries and use-case specific semantics (initial impression, final diagnosis, medical history) via code.coding slicing and category usage.
Captures the ICD-10 external cause axis as a Condition.category slice. Use in addition to the specific diagnosis code.
Final diagnosis per CSV mapping.
Initial impression per CSV mapping.

name.value: Road Safety Condition — Nature of Injury (category)

description.value: Captures the ICD-10 nature-of-injury axis as a Condition.category slice. Use in addition to the specific diagnosis code.
Problem (finding) per CSV mapping.
Evidence and post-crash documentation linked to the incident (e.g., cause of crash, party at fault, incident management logs, CCTV, shape files).
Encounter for EMS run report / facility submission context. Captures incident number, type, timing, participants, disposition & transfer.
Healthcare services offered by organizations (e.g., EMS base, receiving facility clinics/units).
Location of incident; supports PH-Core address extensions and geolocation.
Current medications as codeable concepts or references where available.

name.value: Road Safety Minimum Dataset (MDS) Logical Model

description.value: Abstract, sectioned logical model for the PH Road Safety MDS covering incident, patient, encounter, clinical, vitals, injuries, evidence/documents, workflow, and finance. Elements mirror the CSV rows; mappings point to target FHIR elements for subsequent profiling.
Generic base Observation for road safety data; specialized concept profiles below constrain code/value patterns.
Abrasion present; with optional site and details.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Activity at Time of Incident

description.value: Activity of the patient at time of incident; allow text fallback.
Avulsion present; with optional site and details.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Blood Alcohol Concentration

description.value: Blood alcohol concentration.
Blood pressure using component entries for systolic/diastolic.
Body temperature.
Breath sounds assessment.
Call source description (free text).
Availability of CCTV video.
Clinical remarks/notes.
Collision type (Angle, Head-on, Rear end, Side swipe, etc.).

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Collision vs Non-Collision

description.value: Indicates whether the incident was collision or non-collision.
Concussion present; with site and details.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Condition of Patient

description.value: Overall condition of patient at assessment.
Contusion present; with site and details.
Cyanosis assessment.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Date of Consultation

description.value: Date of consultation at facility.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Date of Injury

description.value: Date of injury occurrence.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Date/Time of Injury

description.value: Timestamp of injury occurrence.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Date/Time Received by EMS

description.value: Calendar/timestamp the EMS/dispatch received the request.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Extent of Injury

description.value: Extent / severity estimate or category of injury (e.g., minor, moderate, severe).

name.value: Road Safety Observation - External Cause: Bites/Stings

description.value: Flag indicating bites/stings.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - External Cause: Burns

description.value: Flag indicating burns as external cause.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - External Cause: Burns

description.value: Flag indicating burns as external cause.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - External Cause: Chemical/Substance

description.value: Observation for chemical/substance exposure.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - External Cause: Contact with Sharp Object

description.value: Flag indicating sharp object cause.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - External Cause: Drowning

description.value: Flag indicating drowning.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - External Cause: Exposure to Forces of Nature

description.value: Flag indicating exposure to natural disaster/calamity.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - External Cause: Fall

description.value: Flag indicating fall.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - External Cause: Firecracker

description.value: Flag indicating firecracker-related cause.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - External Cause: Gunshot

description.value: Flag indicating gunshot.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - External Cause: Hanging/Strangulation

description.value: Flag indicating hanging/strangulation.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - External Cause: Mauling/Assault

description.value: Flag indicating assault.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - External Cause: Other

description.value: Flag indicating other external cause.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - External Cause: Sexual Assault/Abuse/Rape (Alleged)

description.value: Flag indicating sexual assault.
Fracture observation. Use valueCodeableConcept to indicate fracture type (e.g., open or closed). Sites captured in top-level bodySite and details in note.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Glasgow Coma Scale

description.value: GCS with components for eyes, verbal, motor; optional total score as integer.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - How Many Patients Involved

description.value: Count of patients involved.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - How Many Vehicles Involved

description.value: Count of vehicles involved.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - If Alive: Conscious/Unconscious

description.value: If alive on arrival, consciousness detail.
Intent of injury (Unintentional, Intentional-self, Intentional-violence, Undetermined).

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Level of Consciousness (AVPU)

description.value: Level of consciousness (e.g., AVPU).

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Mode of Transport to Facility

description.value: Mode of transport to the hospital/facility; allow coded value with optional text for 'Others'.
Boolean flag indicating multiple injuries.
Open wound present; with site and details. Capture mechanism/type in a structured component (valueCodeableConcept with text).

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Other Risk Factors

description.value: Other risk factors at the time of incident; allow text for 'Others'.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Other Specified Injury

description.value: Other specified injury present; capture type as valueCodeableConcept (text allowed) with optional site and details.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Other Vehicle/Object Involved

description.value: Other vehicle/object type involved; text for 'Others'.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Outcome at Discharge

description.value: Outcome at discharge.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Outcome at Release

description.value: Outcome at release from ER/OPD/RHU.
Type of vehicle used by patient; text for 'Others'.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Place of Occurrence

description.value: Place type where injury occurred; name can be carried in note when applicable.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Position of Patient

description.value: Seat/position (driver/front passenger/rear/pedestrian); text for 'Others'.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Presence of Traffic Investigator

description.value: Boolean presence/absence of traffic investigator.
System-generated urgency level per CAD/agency rules.
Pulse quality.
Pulse/heart rate in beats/min.
Pulse rhythm.
Pupil size/reactivity summary.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Referred By Facility

description.value: Flag indicating patient was referred by another hospital/facility.
Free-text reported complaint.
Respiratory rate in breaths/min.
Respiratory rhythm (normal/irregular/labored).

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Run Report Comments

description.value: General comments from run report.
Safety accessories present/used; allow text for 'Others'.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Status on Arrival

description.value: Status upon reaching facility/hospital.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Time Departed Scene

description.value: Timestamp unit departed scene.
Timestamp when unit dispatched/began traveling.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Time of Consultation

description.value: Time of consultation at facility.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Time of Emergency Station Arrival

description.value: Timestamp unit returned to base/became available.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Time of Hospital Arrival

description.value: Timestamp unit arrived at receiving facility.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Time of Injury

description.value: Time of injury occurrence.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Time On Scene

description.value: Timestamp crew arrived at scene.
Time the call/request was received by EMS/dispatch.

name.value: Road Safety Observation - Transferred From Facility

description.value: Flag indicating patient transferred from another hospital/facility.
Boolean flag indicating transport/vehicular accident.
Traumatic amputation present; with site and details.
Triage category assigned at scene (e.g., Red/Yellow/Green/Black).
Vehicle used during response.
Organization profile for EMS providers and receiving facilities involved in road safety encounters.
Patient demographics and identifiers for road safety reporting; reuse PH-Core address extensions for barangay/city/province/region.
Procedures related to incident/report (e.g., coordination with receiving hospital, psychosocial support, interventions).
Procedure record indicating whether transport coordination with the receiving hospital was done.
Facility/service delivery location. Type bound to HL7 v3 ServiceDeliveryLocationRoleType (e.g., ER, ward, clinic).
Requests or records related to refusal to admit and related workflow signals.
Workflow tracking for report receipt, durations of delay, and sources of delays.

name.value: RS VS - Activity at Time of Incident

description.value: Activity at time of incident (prefer SNOMED CT).
If alive on arrival: conscious vs unconscious.
Type of animal/insect/plant causing bite or sting; use LOINC code where provided in mappings.
Breath sounds options (prefer SNOMED CT).
Burn degree/severity (1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th) as mapped from ONEISS/CSV (SNOMED CT).
Agent causing burn (prefer SNOMED CT).
Collision vs non-collision category.
Cyanosis assessment options (prefer SNOMED CT).
Patient disposition at ER/OPD/BHS/RHU.
Patient disposition for in-patient cases.

name.value: RS VS - Drowning Type/Body of Water

description.value: Type/body of water for drowning incidents.
Glasgow Coma Scale eye opening responses (LOINC LA codes).
Glasgow Coma Scale motor responses (LOINC LA codes).
Glasgow Coma Scale verbal responses (LOINC LA codes).
Injury intent options mapped from ONEISS (prefer SNOMED CT).
AVPU options for level of consciousness (prefer SNOMED CT).

name.value: RS VS - Mode of Transport to Facility

description.value: Mode of transport to the hospital/facility.
Other risk factors at time of incident (prefer SNOMED CT).

name.value: RS VS - Other Vehicle in Collision

description.value: Other vehicle/object involved in collision.
Outcome: Improved, Unimproved, Died.
Vehicle used by patient (prefer SNOMED CT; local additions where specified).
Place of occurrence (prefer SNOMED CT; local additions where specified).
Position/role of patient in transport incidents (prefer SNOMED CT).
PSGC Barangay codes (managed externally).
PSGC City/Municipality codes (managed externally).
PSGC Province codes (managed externally).
PSGC Region codes (managed externally).
Pulse quality options (prefer SNOMED CT).
Pulse rhythm options (prefer SNOMED CT).
Pupil size/reactivity options (prefer SNOMED CT).
Respiratory rhythm options (prefer SNOMED CT).
Safety devices present/used (prefer SNOMED CT).
Status upon reaching facility/hospital.
Exposure context for transport accident: land, water, air (ICD-11).
Type of patient (ER/OPD/RHU/BHS context).
